column4: I installed the XMMS2 package through the synaptic package manager, and I can't seem to access any GUI of it.... I've looked back into the package manager to make sure there isn't a specific GUI package for it, but there doesn't seem to be one, can anyone help me out?
audacious is a sound editing tool?....
No, that's Audacity (how could you get those confused? :P)
nvm, you're right, lmao... I haven't used the thing in a long time. xD Like.... 3 months.. Is it anything like winamp? I just prefer a winamp likeness xD
Actually, I have no idea (never used it)... I only know of it because a friend was looking for an xmms replacement
ah, I see. lol, thanks anyways ^_^' It's pretty much all I need. I can always put it on a workspace out of the way, if it isn't able to minimize into a system tray icon.
USB, god.. who uses gameports anymore? :P
lmao, my only gamepad that I have is pretty old.... *cough* I prefer keyboard for gaming... WASD and what not xD
Ya, me 2... the controller I used is an Xbox controller... just hacked a USB connector on the end
That's pretty interesting.... Time to go out and buy a game console for that..... xD
I plan on getting the entire xbox 360 eventually, anyways.
